node.description: A simple script to be embedded in a python component within the Grasshopper interface. The script divides a surface along its u and v directions creating a subdivision that rationalises the original NURBS geometry. Additionally, it creates tabs for fabrication purposes. See more

node.description:
Documentation is a tedious but necessary pain for any product developer.

Let's solve this real issue and build a real-time documentation robot that on command takes photos or videos and even convert our voice-to-text.

Let's build the ultimate documentation assistant 💪
node.title: Docubot

node.description: A Distributed Hardware Hackathon dedicated to the challenge of building a a documentation assistant that on command takes photos/videos and even converts speech to text. First Edition: Chicago x Madrid x Shenzhen. Thanks to PumpingStationOne, Makerspace Madrid & TroubleMaker Shenzhen.
node.title: The Docubot Challenge

node.title: Simple CNC FoamCutter

node.description: A software + hardware solution to make it as easy as possible to stop procrastinating when in need to document your projects even in the harshest environments, without the need to destroy your smartphone or laptop in the process, if you don't want to.
node.title: Madrid Docubot Team

node.title: The VoiceX

node.description:
It's great that we've already brought together quite a disparate group of people interested in resolving the pain of documentation. We all complain about it, but you actually want to do something about it. That's what brings us here.

If documentation is tedious, perhaps it's a hardware issue and we can build a solution for it.

Docubot can take many forms and be open source, developed by the maker community for the maker community.

I will soon make the project public, but I thought to seed it properly with your collaboration before doing so to arrive at a strong common ground between us all.

And part of that process of curating the strong basis for a collaboration is welcoming you all to introduce yourself!

Calling up on all of you to tell a little about yourself and share how you could contribute to Docubot.

If you have any feedback, we'd highly welcome that you open a New Issue too with your idea or critique.

@juan, @owenlab, @carolportugal, @kevinphy, @salfield, @mkampik, @nicolai, @eseosa, @henkwerner, @pietro, @lilipil, @samershawar, @diyharry, @tokytome
node.title: Introduce yourself to everyone

node.description:
The idea is to connect the camera to a Foot pedal that could be built by using Arduino, and it will be easier to snap photos of the assembly/building process. That will prevent the overlapping of the voice commands of taking pictures and speech to text documentation.

That's an idea, it could be enhanced and i am open for more ideas and suggestions.
node.title: Foot Pedal documentation

node.title: Folder creation problems

node.description:
@mkampik, During the documentation process we experienced several problems with the readme format. Just wanted to make you guys aware - I guess these are known bugs :

1. Links to internal Wikifactory URLs getting out of the words in which they are supposed to be embedded

2. Space between paragraphs disappearing randomly (apparently).
node.title: Readme formatting problems

node.description:
We look forward to announcing the Rewards in our call tomorrow Friday 5 July through Zoom at 3pm CEST.

You still have till the end of today Thursday 4th July to submit any final contributions or changes to be considered!
node.title: REWARDS DEADLINE - add any additional information by today to be considered for Rewards!

node.description:
We are deciding (very soon) a tree of folders with different categories. Inside every category there are more categories and more folders and finally a readme in the last folder with some information and images or Videos.

Is it possible to generate a main readme composed of all that readmes?

Thanks!
node.title: How to make a main Readme composed of Readmes inside folders

node.description:

  • AHD Subtitles Maker

  • Subtitle Workshop

  • SubtitleCreator
node.title: Subtitle programs for video tags

node.description:
We have some files consists of images, videos and Readmes on folders that we want to upload to the repository by our own DocuBot software. Is it possible? There is any way to do it?

Examples and tips welcome!
node.title: How to upload videos by script (terminal) on the Wikifactory repository project

node.description:
A template for open initiatives developing digitally fabricated components + hardware solutions for emergency medical supplies.

Simply download the Template and upload it into the Drive of a new Project to guide your product development. Available in multiple languages.
node.name: Template-medical-devices
node.title: Template-medical-devices

node.description:
as you did in the rest, would write this

INTRODUCTION

Briefly explain the purpose behind this project as an introduction.

Briefly explain the fabrication machines and materials that are intended.

Briefly explain the supporting evidence for the need

What external links or prior work can you reference to support?

like

INTRODUCTION

what is the purpose you want to reach with this project? (briefly 500 characthers)

what do i need to make it? please explain both machines and materials

why do you think it's needed? can you share evidences to support it?

What external links or prior work can you reference to support?
node.title: set all the sectors as questions

node.description: Thanks for this wonderful intitiative ! Exactly what I was hoping for ! Would it be possible to have the template adadpted and translated in different language? I can help for French. And we could have curated and medically validated contributions in separate repositories depending on language and local regulatiosn/needs? French, Swiss and Belgian Makers could make great use of such features...
node.title: Translation in different languages / European regulation compatible  contribution repository

node.description: This project demonstrates what features are available for Projects on Wikifactory. Our version-controlled Drive for file hosting with an embedded CAD file viewer for over 30 formats, the flexible documentation editor and the Issue tracker to manage tasks and feedback!
node.title: Wikifactory Demo Project

node.description:
Public Street Furniture project, temporarily installed in Galway City in 2015.

Very proud to be featured in this ArchDaily Article:

https://www.archdaily.com/794566/the-best-student-design-build-projects-worldwide-2016
node.title: Galway City Bench

node.description: Otto Chaplin designed & made by 10 yo Thelmo at KidsCodingClub/je{ux] sais FAIRE Maker Camp: 5 days to design in Tinkercad your own version of +OttoDIY Thelmo wanted a Chaplin, he was our project manager, we helped a little with the arms and the cane, the rest was all his work. #OttoRemixChallenge
node.title: Otto Chaplin

node.description: CNCFrog will help you create a real detail based on a computer model. Using a suitable drawing program, create your model and using CNCJS software (https://cnc.js.org) send it to a milling machine whose GRBL firmware will mill the finished element.
node.title: CNCFrog assembly

node.description: En este proyecto, aprenderás a construir un robot seguidor de lineas con un diseño maker, Desarrollado con una placa Arduino y utilizando un diseño hecho en cortes láser de madera.
node.title: Robot LineSpeed

node.description: This is a guide to converting an AnyCubic Kossel plastic printer to be become a Clay 3D Printer
node.title: Clay AnyCubic Conversion
